data.title: PEASANTS OF LANGUEDOC by Emmanuel Le Roy Ladurie
data.meta_description: Â  Â  Â  Â Hailed as a pioneering work of Â Â Â Â Â  "total history" when it was published in France in 1966, Le Roy Ladurie's Â Â Â Â Â  volume combines elements of human geography, historical demography, economic Â Â Â Â Â  history, and folk culture in a broad depiction of a great agrarian cycle, Â Â Â Â Â  lasting from the Renaissance to the Enlightenment. It describes the conflicts Â Â Â Â Â  and contradictions of a traditional peasant society in which the rise in Â Â Â Â Â  population was not matched by increases in wealth and food production.    Â Â Â Â Â  "It presents us with a great study of rural history, an analysis of economic change and a description of a society in movement that has few equals." -- Washington Post Book World "It is without any doubt one of the most important, if not the most important, monograph of the French Annales school of socio-economic historians written in the last decade." -- Canadian Historical Review Â
